Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2009 08:23AM LisainTX wrote: So they know before they do the surgery? I had a lumpectomy (Left Breast)Â on the 1st (waiting on the results). No Biopsy straight into a Lumpectomy. They removed a lot of tissue(Breast significantly smaller). The Dr said it looked like DCIS, but it could be IDC? I had two separate clusters of calcification's. I had a biopsy on the right one last year and it was ADH. Follow up Mammo in Feb said everything was clear can calcification's grow that quickly? Sorry. New here. Thanks for any answers.
Posts.Title: HAS ANYONE GETTING A BIOPS BEEN GIVEN A PERCENTAGE? juliarose sheila888

Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2009 08:53AM LisainTX wrote: I had a mammo, and ultrasound, and 3 days latter the lumpectomy. I did not talk to the Dr afterwords, and of course he is to busy to talk to me now. I guess I am just confused. Do they do a lumpectomy when its not cancer? I guess thers a part of me that wants to believe its not cancer. I never got a straight answer just that it could be. Thanks Sheila.

Posts.Content: Sep 7, 2009 09:25AM LisainTX wrote: Yes I have a four inch incision. They put wires in two different places, and put me to sleep. They took a lot of tissue out. This happened so fast, and I did not get to talk to the surgeron after, and do not remember before they gave me a loopy shot before surgery.
